page.title: 01Gazeteer
page.content: Our four by three kilometre rectangle is situated in the Northern part of Scotland, West of the Cromarty Firth. The area we live in is mainly agricultural land ,even though it Â£s not a flat area.The remainder of the land is mainly forests of coniferous and deciduous trees.Our area contains two communities,Maryburgh and Conon Bridge.The nearest large city is Inverness which is eleven miles to the South.During the summer months this area is a popular tourist centre with many attractions for the visitors such as Forest trails,Mountain walk, Angling and easy access to much of Scotland's finest scenery.There is very little Industry within this area apart from Agriculture and Foresty.The nearest shopping centre is Dingwall which is one mile to the North.
